title: jvanname
author: jvanname
content: I am making this thread as a place for Bitcoiners to improve their social communication skills and to become better people. Unfortunately, the Bitcoin community seems to be exceedingly angry, arrogant, and quite evil. This community has very poor social communication skills. This community is absolutely insufferable. Bitcoiners hate science. Bitcoiners are immature, childish, and really dysfunctional. The greater cryptocurrency community is not much better because they fall for scams (they are dumb), and they worship stupid people because they themselves are stupid.The Bitcoin community cannot stand any criticism because they are in a cult, and how dare I criticize Bitcoin. I will criticize Bitcoin when it needs to be criticized. If you don't like it, then you are simply deceiving yourself.This page will probably attract people who are not willing to work on their social communication skills and improve themselves but who are instead here only to display their own stupidity. That is really sad, but hopefully someone will use this thread to work on social communication and improving themselves.-Joseph Van Name Ph.D.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Interesting… I don’t think that the Bitcoin community as a whole has social problems. I think it’s more of an internet roll thing. The few crazy people who go around here telling outlandish lies and leaving negative feedback for attention really are a small segment of the community. Using the ignore button when you come across them can save you a lot of heartache and you’ll be able to enjoy the mostly nice folks here.

However, I usually don't categorize people in such a way. Who are Bitcoiners really? Drawing such conclusions from a few sentences exchanged online, like here, seems unjust and unwise. People have diverse opinions, and it is true that some can be rather passionate about their views. I get that vibe a lot. But aren't we all guilty of similar behavior? In fact, if we take a step back and reflect, we may find that we all, at times, display passionate or strong-willed behavior about topics we deeply care about. Would you not agree?

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: jvanname on October 05, 2023, 10:21:08 PM-cut-o48o-I am ignoring you. While I acknowledge the existence of your post, I will not respond to the content of your post. You are a shithead. You have spiders in your pituitary gland, and you have mushrooms in your bladder.Ok those insults made me laugh out loud. I'll give you few tips for social communication anxiety though:1. Try to see good in everyone.2. Let your starting point for listening to be humble. 3. Instead of seeing people as stupid or evil enemies, first assume that they have good intentions and pure motives. That they want to be constructive, but sometimes they just need a little help with it.5. Do not presume, ask. and listen when they explain to understand their point of view. Even when it's hard to do. It's a good practice for empathy.I see you as a smart guy who is just having hard time. Try to recognize your feelings and accept them. You are angry, yes, and you think it's because of others. You can try to change others, but i am guessing you are starting to see it won't go as you planned. So maybe you need to find another solution. Maybe there are more feelings inside after you accept them as part of you. And the fact they are not coming from outside. Good luck with that social communication and have a great day.

comments.body: This is the kind of thread which only brings me concern on the mental well being of some people who may have access to internet. Doctor, if there is something bothering you or something which is making your daily life to be more difficult, you should not ignore it, but to talk about it with your family or people whose job is to help people to feel better. What's the point of engaging with people who you consider to be stupid, mean, evil or uneducated?Please consider to talk about your issues and address them with those you trust irl.Blessings
